comments: If n is a power of a prime p, then a(n) = n*(p-1). - _Robert Israel_, May 20 2015
links: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = LCM[n, A000010[n], A051953[n]].For n=p prime, Phi[p]=p-1, cototient[p]=p-1, a(p)=p(p-1)=A009262(p).a(n) = n*A000010(n)*A051953(n)/A009195(n)^2. - _Robert Israel_, May 20 2015
maple: seq(ilcm(n, numtheory:-phi(n),n - numtheory:-phi(n)), n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, May 20 2015
mathematica: Table[LCM[n, EulerPhi[n], n - EulerPhi[n]], {n, 53}] (* _Ivan Neretin_, May 20 2015 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 20 2000
